target.name: Sect3
target.text: Enabling wsclient.bat (Windows systems only)

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Use a command line window to cd to the /ssf/samples/remotingclient directory.

target.name: Step
target.text: Use a command line window to cd to the /ssf/samples/remotingclient directory.

target.name: Step
target.text: Type wsclient.bat.

target.name: Step
target.text: On the same line, type a wsclient.bat command name and desired arguments.

target.name: Step
target.text: Press the Return key.

target.name: Sect1
target.text: Notes about Specific Messages

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Adding Folders and the Binder Configuration Identifier

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Click Manage workspace and folder templates in the administration portlet.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Manage workspace and folder templates in the administration portlet.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the "Currently defined templates" section, click Blog.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Manage this target > Configure.

target.name: Procedure
target.text: View any workspace or folder.

target.name: Step
target.text: View any workspace or folder.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Manage > Add folder.

target.name: Step
target.text: While viewing the Add new folder page, use your browser to view the HTML source code for the page.

target.name: Step
target.text: Search for the type of folder you want to create (for example, discussion, blog, calendar, and so on).

target.name: Step
target.text: In the input HTML tag that creates the radio button for that type of folder, note the name="binderConfigId" and value="nnn" pair of tag elements.

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Adding Items and the Definition Identifier

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Sign in to Novell Teaming as a site administrator.

target.name: Step
target.text: Sign in to Novell Teaming as a site administrator.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the administration portlet, click the plus sign (+) next to Form and view designers.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click the category of the item you want to create using the Web services (for example, click Entry designer if you want your Web service call to create an entry).

target.name: Step
target.text: Click the plus sign (+) next to Entry definitions.

target.name: Step
target.text: Locate the title of the item you want to create (for example, Blog entry), and note the identifier in parentheses next to the title (for example, _blogEntry).

target.name: Step
target.text: In the XML returned by getDefinitionListAsXML, parse the string until you find the type of item you want to create (for example, name="_blogEntry").

target.name: Step
target.text: Continue parsing that same element until you locate the id attribute.

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Tips for All Messages that Add and Modify Entries

target.name: Procedure
target.text: In the Novell Teaming UI, create an entry of the type you want your Web services client to be able to create or modify, and specify a value for every element on the creation form.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Novell Teaming UI, create an entry of the type you want your Web services client to be able to create or modify, and specify a value for every element on the creation form.

target.name: Step
target.text: Mouse over the title of the created entry and note the entry identifier in URL displayed in your browser:

target.name: Step
target.text: Either use the printFolderEntry command for wsclient.bat or use the getFolderEntryAsXML message to view the XML contents of the entry you just created in the UI.

target.name: Step
target.text: Use the XML information you retrieved as a template for the string you need to pass to create a new entry or to modify one.

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Migrating Users

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Use either LDAP or the Import profiles administration-portlet tool to add your Forum users to Novell Teaming.

target.name: Step
target.text: Use either LDAP or the Import profiles administration-portlet tool to add your Forum users to Novell Teaming.

target.name: Step
target.text: Use the addUserWorkspace message to add personal workspaces for the new Novell Teaming users.

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Migrating Files

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Establish a directory on the Novell Teaming server machine where you want to place the Forum files.

target.name: Step
target.text: Establish a directory on the Novell Teaming server machine where you want to place the Forum files.

target.name: Step
target.text: Make the three required changes to the ssf.properties and ssf-ext.properties files. This action indicates the location of the staging directory. (See the installation guide for more information about the these files.)

target.name: Step
target.text: Copy the Forum files onto the Novell Teaming server, using the specified staging directory as your top directory.

target.name: Step
target.text: Use the migrateFolderFileStaged message to migrate the files into the Novell Teaming installation.

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Migrating Custom Commands and Workflow

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Migrate your Forum users to Novell Teaming.

target.name: Step
target.text: Migrate your Forum users to Novell Teaming.

target.name: Step
target.text: Use the getAllPrincipalsAsXML message to get a list of the user identifiers for the newly created Teaming users.

target.name: Step
target.text: Create a mapping file that maps Teaming user identifiers to Forum usernames.

target.name: Step
target.text: Run a Tcl script-which uses the mapping file-to generate an XML file of workflow information.

target.name: Step
target.text: Import the workflow XML file into Novell Teaming.

target.name: Step
target.text: Create another mapping file, which maps workflow identifiers in Novell Teaming to Forum workflow names.

target.name: Step
target.text: Run a Tcl script-which uses the second mapping file-to generate an XML file of custom command information.

target.name: Step
target.text: Import the custom command XML into Novell Teaming.
